choose diety.description: The player must choose a deity to follow. The player gains access to this deity’s blessing but must also follow all of the deity’s commandments otherwise the player loses all abilities.

barrier.description: As a full action the player may set up a magical barrier around him/herself. This barrier lasts until the player is the target of an attack. While the barrier is up if an attack is aimed at the player, he/she may roll 1d20 + wis mod. If the player's roll is higher than the “To hit” roll aimed at him/her than the barrier successfully blocks the attack and is destroyed. If the player's roll is lower, then the barrier is overpowered/destroyed, and the player takes normal damage.

prayer.description: As a full action you may heal yourself 1d4 this may only be done during combat and during periods of long rests and takes 2 spell charges.

sword egis.description: You may as a full action enter a mediation. Each turn you remain in this meditation costs 1 spell charge. while in this mediation you may focus on another player. So long as they remain in sight of you, all sword attacks aimed at them have a 50% chance of having their damage reduced by 1d4. While in this mediation you may not take any given action, move actions, normal actions, or full actions otherwise your mediation is broken. Your meditation is also broken if you are hit. You are also considered helpless while meditating.

charge heal 1.description: As a normal action you may touch an ally and use spell charges to heal them. You may use as many spell charges as you have, and each spell charge you use heals the ally by 1 HP. The spell charges are depleted after using them this way.

blessed weapon.description: As a full action your weapon now deals normal damage and an extra 1d8 damage to those weak to holiness.

sanctuary 1.description: As a full action you may use 2 spell charges to fill a square with a maximum size of 10ft x 10ft with a spell that raises the Defense Score of anyone inside it by 2. This bonus goes away immediately when they leave the square. You may place as many of these on the battlefield as you want but only 1 may be placed before combat. A portion of this square must be within 60 ft. of you when you place it. The duration of the protective spell is 10 minutes or until you declare that you want to end the spell.

shisa.description: You may craft a living Shisa. This creature shares all your stats except it has 15 Hp and deals 1d6 damage on attacks. Shisa’s share a turn with you and commanding it to move and attack is a single move action for you. It may also stand outside a house with its mouth open preventing any spirits from entering that house or it may stand outside the house with its mouth closed preventing any spirits from leaving the house. It cannot move or attack while standing this way and all attacks against it automatically hit. Crafting a new Shisa takes 1 week of work and you must have stone and stone cutting tools. You may only keep 1 Shisa alive at any given time.

sacrificial heal.description: As a normal action, and at a touch, you may take 1d8 damage and heal an ally 1d10.

man of knowledge.description: +2 to knowledge mundane or mythical knowledge checks for identifying the practices of religions or cults and identifying deities.

holy water.description: The player may bless a vial of water and throw it up to 40 ft. It fills a 15ft x 15ft square and deals 1d6 damage to any enemies in that area weak to holiness. It soaks enemies that are not.

salt circle 1.description: As a full action the player may use 2 spell charges to create a 10ft x 10ft circle of salt within 40 ft. of him/herself. Everyone who remains inside the circle gets a +2 bonus to their Body and mind score. This bonus disappears immediately if they leave the circle. You may place as many of these on the battlefield as you want but only 1 may be placed before combat.

grimoire removal.description: The player may spend 1 day reversing the effects of a grimoire ritual.

ranged healer 1.description: The player may use 2 spell charges to increase the range of “Charge Heal” abilities up to 60 ft.

holy symbol.description: As a move action you may grab your holy symbol and remove a curse, hex, or poison from yourself. (You must be unrestrained in order to perform this action).

sanctuary 2.description: As a full action you may use 2 spell charges to fill a square with a maximum size of 15ft x 15ft with a spell that raises the Defense Score of anyone inside it by 2. This bonus goes away immediately when they leave the square. You may place as many of these on the battlefield as you want but only 1 may be placed before combat. A portion of this square must be within 60 ft. of you when you place it. The duration of the protective spell is 10 minutes or until you declare that you want to end the spell.

light.description: As a full action and at touch you may make a small object glow. It lights a 30ft area around the thing that you just touched. You may only have 1 instance of this spell at any given time.

health egis 1.description: You may as a full action enter a mediation. Each turn you remain in this meditation costs 1 spell charge. While in this mediation you may focus on 1 player within sight of you. Every turn this player has a 50% chance to heal 1d4. While in this mediation you may not take any given action, move actions, normal actions or full actions otherwise your mediation is broken. If you are hit, your meditation is also broken. You are also considered helpless while meditating.

helper.description: The player gains a +2 bonus to surgical checks.

holy blast 1.description: As a normal action the player may use 2 spell charges to let out a blast of energy that fills a straight line in front of him/her for 80ft. This deals 1d10 damage to everyone in the line and 1d12 if they are weak to holiness.

salt circle 2.description: As a full action the player may use 2 spell charges to create a 15ft x 15ft circle of salt within 40 ft. of him/herself. Everyone who remains inside the circle gets a +2 bonus to their Body and mind score. This bonus disappears immediately if they leave the circle. You may place as many of these on the battlefield as you want but only 1 may be placed before combat.

rewriting fate.description: You may reroll healing spells and buffs by taking 1d8 damage to yourself. (This may only be used when attempting to heal or buff others and not yourself.)

charge heal 2.description: As a normal action you may touch an ally and use spell charges to heal them. You may use as many spell charges as you have, and each spell charge you use heals the ally by 2 HP. The spell charges are depleted after using them this way.

power strike.description: Player may choose to take a -3 penalty to hit and gain a +3 to damage on melee attacks. The player must declare they are doing this before rolling “To Hit”.

sanctuary 3.description: As a full action you may use 2 spell charges to fill a square with a maximum size of 15ft x 15ft with a spell that raises the Defense Score of anyone inside it by 3. This bonus goes away immediately when they leave the square. You may place as many of these on the battlefield as you want but only 1 may be placed before combat. A portion of this square must be within 60 ft. of you when you place it. The duration of the protective spell is 10 minutes or until you declare that you want to end the spell.

wall of light 1.description: As a normal action you may use 1 spell charge to create a transparent wall that only you can see. This wall fills a 15ft line. You can take cover behind this wall. If the enemy doesn’t know that you set up the wall (this usually requires a stealth check vs the enemy’s perception check to cast it secretly) the first attack aimed at you while taking cover behind it automatically fails. You may only have 2 of these walls out at any given time. The wall may only be cast after combat has started.

critical spell.description: When you get a critical hit with a spell instead of dealing double damage you can now cast another spell from a different spell School than your first spell.

ranged healer 2.description: The player may use 1 spell charges to increase the range of “Charge Heal” abilities up to 60 ft.

selfless sacrifice.description: When a teammate within 60ft is being attacked by a damage dealing spell the Abjurer may redirect the spell at him/herself by sacrificing their next move action.

health egis 2.description: You may as a full action enter a mediation. Each turn you remain in this meditation costs 1 spell charge. While in this mediation you may focus on 1 player within sight of you. Every turn this player has a 50% chance to heal 1d6. While in this mediation you may not take any given action, move actions, normal actions or full actions otherwise your mediation is broken. If you are hit, your meditation is also broken. You are also considered helpless while meditating.

elemental sanctuary.description: The player may summon a small and sacred 25ft square area that provides protection from the elements and no undead may enter it. However, anyone inside the sanctuary cannot attack anyone or anything outside the sanctuary. (The player may not use this in conjunction with Selfless Sacrifice.)

quick charge.description: The player may generate 2 spell charges as a move action rather than 1. (This means that you can now generate 3 spell charges as a full action).

holy infusion.description: You may touch a companion or yourself as a full action, now the next spell they cast may count as dealing holy damage and hurt those weak to holiness. So, a spell that deals 1d6 fire damage would now deal 1d6 holy damage. A spell that fills an area with poison would now fill that area with a blessed cloud.

health egis 3.description: You may as a full action enter a mediation. Each turn you remain in this meditation costs 1 spell charge. While in this mediation you may focus on 1 player within sight of you. Every turn this player has a 50% chance to heal 1d8. While in this mediation you may not take any given action, move actions, normal actions or full actions otherwise your mediation is broken. If you are hit, your meditation is also broken. You are also considered helpless while meditating.

holy blast 2.description: As a normal action the player may use 2 spell charges to let out a blast of energy that fills a straight line in front of him/her for 80ft. This deals 1d10 damage to everyone in the line and 1d12 if they are weak to holiness.

wall of light 2.description: As a normal action you may use 1 spell charge to create a transparent wall that only you can see. This wall fills a 20ft line. You can take cover behind this wall. If the enemy doesn’t know that you set up the wall (this usually requires a stealth check vs the enemy’s perception check to cast it secretly) the first attack aimed at you while taking cover behind it automatically fails. You may only have 2 of these walls out at any given time. The wall may only be cast after combat has started.

charge heal 3.description: As a normal action you may touch an ally and use spell charges to heal them. You may use as many spell charges as you have, and each spell charge you use heals the ally by 3 HP. The spell charges are depleted after using them this way.

ranged healer 3.description: The player may increase the range of “Charge Heal” abilities up to 60 ft. This requires no spell charges.

holy shell.description: As a normal action the player may set up a holy shell of light around him/herself or around another player. This shell lasts until the player is the target of an attack. While the shell is up if an attack is aimed at the player, he/she may roll 1d20 + Wis mod + Cha mod. If the player's roll is higher than the “To Hit” roll aimed at him/her then the barrier successfully blocks the attack and is destroyed. If the player's roll is lower, then the barrier is overpowered/destroyed, and the player takes normal damage.

charge heal 4.description: As a normal action you may touch an ally and use spell charges to heal them. You may use as many spell charges as you have, and each spell charge you use heals the ally by 5 HP. The spell charges are depleted after using them this way.

wall of light 3.description: As a normal action you may use 1 spell charge to create a transparent wall that only you can see. This wall fills a 30ft line. You can take cover behind this wall. If the enemy doesn’t know that you set up the wall (this usually requires a stealth check vs the enemy’s perception check to cast it secretly) the first attack aimed at you while taking cover behind it automatically fails. You may only have 2 of these walls out at any given time. The wall may only be cast after combat has started.

glue.description: As a normal action and at a range of up to 30 ft. an alchemist may make a ranged attack. If successful, the target of this attack and the alchemist are now connected. This attack has a “To Hit” of 1d20 + Int Mod.

preserve brew 1.description: When the player attempts to make a potion or poison and fails their craft check there is a 25% chance that they do not destroy the ingredients.

collector.description: When collecting alchemy ingredients there is a 25% chance the player will gather 2 of the ingredients instead of 1.

gas transmute.description: As a normal action and at touch the player may use 1 spell charge to turn fog, blood mist, or smoke into a poison cloud or miasma. The reverse works as well.

items.prescribed experience: The player gains proficiency with a weapon of his or her choice for the duration of the concoction’s effects.

items.rubber skin: Every time you are hit with a sword or ax there is a 50% chance you take no damage, but every time you are hit by a blunt stave, pole arm, throwing weapon, spell, or hammer there is a 50% chance you take double damage.

items.bottled muscle memory: You gain an extra normal action every turn, but your Defense Score is lowered by 8.

items.chameleon draught: You gain the ability to hide in plain sight without needing to be behind something or in the shadows, but you also move 1 square slower than normal.

concoctions 1.description: The player gains the ability to make 1 concoction every short rest (4 or more hours). Concoctions go bad after 1 day and require at least 1 monster part to make. Although they may use any monster part. The effects of concoctions may not stack with other concoctions but may stack with a mutation serum. The effects of a concoction last until the player is able to take a long rest. Long rests are the only way to remove the effects of the concoction. Concoctions are designed for your physiology and therefore may not be used by other party members. You may attempt to take 2 concoctions at the same time however you take 1d20 damage every hour and there is only a 50% chance to gain the benefits of the second concoction. The 1d20 damage gained this way may not be healed with potions or magic, the only way to heal this damage is through resting. Each time a player makes a concoction he/she may choose from the following list:

charge potion 1.description: After generating 2 spell charges you may transfer them into a glass flask as a move action.  You may then give this flask to another party member as another move action (for you), and they may drink it as a move action to gain 2 charges. This potion can only be generated in combat however it does not expire until the end of the in-game week. This potion may also be placed in a syringe once the player unlocks that skill.

liquid transmute.description: At a touch and as a normal action the player may use 1 spell charge to turn a 15ft x 15ft square of water, blood or oil into poison or lava or vice versa.

solid transmute.description: As a normal action and at touch the player may use a spell charge to turn 12 inches of wood, dirt or ice into a steel melee weapon of any type that deals 1d6 + int damage.

oxidation.description: : Player may as a normal action and at touch destroy a steel weapon by turning it into rust. This is a 1d20 + Int mod attack that is aimed at the Defense Score. This provokes an attack of opportunity that triggers after determining if the weapon is destroyed.
